intro: Craccina taurica, commonly known as the Taurian craccina, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the steppes of the Caucasus and southern Russia, where it thrives in dry, open habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand the arid conditions of its native environment. Craccina taurica is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
